subject: Re: Can I get some help, please?
body:
Thanks for writing back.  Based on your response it sounds
like you don't want to encourage people to make local
limited archives that may not include all dists.

Incidentally, I did read the anonftpsync script many times
before writing to the list.  I just thought there might
be better documentation available somewhere.  I've read
through the entire /mirrors section of the debian.org
site several times.

Josip Rodin wrote:
> On Sat, May 19, 2007 at 09:18:22PM -0400, Carl T. Miller wrote:
>> What are the minimal files required for installation only of
>> a single arch?
>
> Hmm. I don't think we have this documented anywhere properly, because
> the netinst CD gets all the debs of the base system, and optionally gets
> whatever is in the tasks that the user selects. Those various sets of
> packages are fairly intricate...

I'll try to write something that would only mirror a single
archive and then get feedback.

>> Are there a set of files required by the original archive
>> and official mirrors (that would let me test to find a
>> limited mirror)?
>
> As we only support removal of architectures, you can simply check the
> fourth
> column of http://www.debian.org/mirror/list if you want to find how each
> mirror is limited (which architectures are missing).

What I'd like is to be able to test a file in the archive to know
whether or not I'm working with an official mirror.  It sounds
like there isn't a good way to do this.

c
